title: S.A.’s delicious best showcased on national TV

Photo: Meredith Hayashi/San Antonio Express-News Image 23 of 23 S.A.’s delicious best showcased on national TV 1 / 23 Back to Gallery Quick! Get to your TVs or set your DVRs! Hunky Australian chef and TV personality Pete Evans showcases San Antonio and surrounding destinations, along with two of the city's leading chefs, Jason Dady and Diana Barrios-Treviño, on Sunday's "Moveable Feast with Fine Cooking."
Watch the picturesque and deliciously informative episode at 4 p.m. today on PBS affiliate KLRN-TV.
The chefs' initial stop is for some scrumptious-looking handmade tortillas at the Sanitary Tortilla factory at 623 Urban Loop, which is the supplier of tortillas to over 85 restaurants across Texas. Next, Pete and Diana visit Bending Branch Winery to select some local wines for their meal.
After a look at how Dady unwinds – horseback riding, the chef cooks up a roasted chile salsa while Treviño prepares her fresh salsa and one of the main dishes – puffy chicken tacos with a side of classic rice and beans. "They look like Mick Jagger's lips," Treviño quips about her puffy tacos.
Dady's main dish also is mouth-watering: beef fajitas with tomatillo-walnut mole, pickled pepperonata, and fresh tortillas.
To top it all off, Dady prepares an irresistible dessert: a delicious wood-fired strawberry crostata with ice cream.
A warning: Don't watch this while hungry. . .unless you can get hold of the ingredients yourself and try to duplicate the dishes. Get recipes here.
jjakle@express-news.net
